articles.image_title: Queen Elizabeth II death. File photo dated 25/10/2005 of the Prince of Wales and The Duchess of Cornwall arrive at Buckingham Palace to attend a State Banquet. Issue date: Thursday September 8, 2022. The wife of the Prince of Wales - formerly Mrs Camilla Parker-Bowles - is now Queen, no matter what title she chooses, and is no longer the Duchess of Cornwall as this title now belongs to Kate after William inherited the title the Duke of Cornwall and became the Duke of Cornwall and Cambridge. See PA story DEATH Queen Camilla. Photo credit should read: Andrew Parsons/PA Wire URN:68709814

articles.title: Diese zwei Antikörper machen Coronaviren unschädlich
articles.image_title: Illustration of antibodies (y-shaped) responding to an infection with the new coronavirus SARS-CoV-2. The virus emerged in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, and causes a mild respiratory illness (covid-19) that can develop into pneumonia and be fatal in some cases. The coronaviruses take their name from their crown (corona) of surface proteins, which are used to attach and penetrate their host cells. Once inside the cells, the particles use the cells' machinery to make more copies of the virus. Antibodies bind to specific antigens, for instance viral proteins, marking them for destruction by other immune cells, such as the macrophage white blood cell behind the virus.
articles.author: Edda Grabar

articles.image_title: BRUSSELS, BELGIUM - FEBRUARY 28: Czech Minister of Industry and Trade Jozef Sikela is talking to media in the Europa, the EU Council headquarter on February 28, 2022 in Brussels, Belgium. Following the invasion of Ukraine by Russian forces, EU energy ministers will convene in Brussels to discuss the current situation of the energy market in Europe. The Russian invasion of Ukraine has caused an increase in the price of gas in the EU and in global oil prices. This increase is happening in the context of a pre-existing spike in energy prices in the EU. (Photo by Thierry Monasse/Getty Images)
